summary: API reference documentation shows repeated 'v1' namespace labels in the menu, appearing as a bug. User requests clarification by either showing both namespace and version (e.g., 'command.v1', 'common.v1') or omitting generated protobuf types from the reference.
userImpact: Users find the API reference documentation confusing due to unclear labeling of namespace versions in the menu.
rootCause: Generated protobuf types are displayed in the API reference menu without clear distinction between namespace and version labels.
proposedFix: Either clarify menu items to show 'namespace.version' format (e.g., 'command.v1', 'common.v1') or omit generated protobuf types from the API reference entirely.
resolutionDetails: Issue was addressed by considering whether to omit generated protobuf types from the API reference, related to issue #115.
keyQuote: we might just want to omit the generated protobuf types from the API reference. Let's consider our options.
